inn1.comm: And Rampaul negates the slips by digging this halfway down the track, which doesn't quite generate any bounce. Hafeez is back early, and pulls this through midwicket. Good start for Hafeez
pitched slightly further up, and Hafeez shoulders arms to it
fuller but still full enough to be driven. Left alone again
Perfect length! Just short of the driving length, but full enough to draw Hafeez forward. And it swings away a touch, past tentative Hafeez bat
closer to the stumps now, Hafeez defends solidly
pulls the length back, and immediately Hafeez is comfortable with the punch shot through the covers
full and straight, flicked to midwicket
stays leg-stump line again, pushed to short midwicket
full, on middle and leg, driven wide of long-on for two
full, on the pads, flat, easy single to leg
and he keeps the leg line up with the right-hand batsman too, Hafeez can't place it past square leg
comes forward, turns this around the corner for one
back of a length, outside off, left alone
closer to off, Hafeez pushes this to cover
left alone again outside off. Hafeez off to a typical tight start
beaten by pace as he looks to flick this into the leg side. The ball rolls off the pad towards cover
this time he accepts the gift, a real gift as this is angling way down the leg side and the short fine leg is up. Hafeez is in too good a form to miss out on these
comes forward to solidly defend this towards mid-off
tossed up on leg, flicked to square leg
appeal for leg-before, very faint appeal, because this is pitched outside leg
similar, flat delivery on the pads, pushed to short midwicket
attacking the pads again, just short of a length, Taufeeq misses on the flick
stays flat, fast, on the pads, can't beat the infield
flipper, Taufeeq is hurried into bringing the bat down. Good controlled defensive bowling
comes forward, opens the bat face, gets a single to third man
bouncer, over middle and leg, Taufeeq ducks under it

Edged and taken. Rampaul strikes early. Taufeeq's comeback is cut short. This is back of a length, seems to be angling across him, but jags back a bit, thus taking the inside edge of the hanging bat. Faint edge

and nearly another wicket as Shehzad is looking to leave this outside off and the ball hits the bat even as he is withdrawing. Not sure of the off stump, not sure what he is doing. It goes safely though, past the second slip
some away swing here, but Hafeez is much more certain wit his leave
just the one slip for Hafeez and this edge goes past it. Along the ground, because he played at it with soft hands
flat legbreak, pitches middle, turns away, stays back and pushes it towards long-on
another flat legbreak, hits him on the back pad, but this seems to be missing off
fuller this time, easy to come forward and defend
toppie, initially seemed to have been done in by it as he shuffled across right in front, but then glanced it pretty fine
slower through the air, slight turn there, but slow enough for him to stay back and defend
stays on the crease to push this fullish delivery to mid-on
driven on the up, but to short cover on the bounce
beautiful shot, stretching forward, and just meeting the ball, full and wide. The push drive goes between short cover and cover. Hafeez is looking ominous
good comeback, this one seams in off a length, but Hafeez gets the inside edge onto the pad. This would have been close otherwise
this goes the other way, Rampaul v Hafeez is interesting now, as this beats the outside edge with the outswing
Hafeez has his own back now, this is a half-volley, and wide too, and he square-drives it, past cover-point
now he comes right forward to defend this under his nose
angling into the pads, turned away to midwicket
makes room to cut, makes contact in front of off, but can't hit it past short cover
stays flat and straight, defended off the back foot
a touch too straight, and turned away for a single
stretches forward to defend, is hit on the pad, there is half a shout, but it seems to be angled down the leg side
Hafeez shows his three stumps early, Martin stays stump to stump, Hafeez gets an inside edge on the defensive shot. No alarms, though
presses forward and pushes this length ball towards short cover
angling into the pads, worked away wide of mid-on
runs this down to third man for one
full, too wide of off to involve him
back of a length, played back to the bowler
stays in the crease to push this back to the bowler
turn there, Martin slows this one down, giving it time to grip the surface, breaking away from off and middle, beating Hafeez's outside edge
this is flatter and straighter, Hafeez just pushes it back
a touch slower again, drawing Hafeez forward, who defends with an open face
quicker again, pushed past cover this time, comes back for two
fuller, slower, defended off the front foot
leg and middle, Hafeez is right forward in defence
back of a length, middle and leg, pushed to midwicket
steered away to third man for one
given room again, and steered away for one more
slower ball, outside off, pushed back to Sammy
shorter, but Shehzad comes forward and punches this down the ground. Can't beat mid-off
stays on the crease to push a shortish delivery to short midwicket
shortish outside off, pushed to cover
full outside off, pushed wide of mid-off
backs away early, Martin follows him with a flat delivery, played back to Martin
stays leg stump, Shehzad pushes this back to Martin
cut away from in front of middle, a lot of risk for one run
short again, pushed down to long-off
short and wide, cut away to deep point
backing away early again, Sammy stays middle and leg, Shehzad gets an inside edge onto the pad
moves across this time, Sammy bowls wide of off, and again he has no room either way, and ends up playing to cover
more orthodox this time, leaves it be outside off
full and straight, pushed back to Sammy. Shehzad struggling to get the ball off the square
moves inside the line of a straight ball to go leg side, but can't hit past midwicket
one of the rare loose deliveries, going down the leg side, but Hafeez misses on the big sweep
well done, calculated risk, opens the front leg, and semi-slog-sweeps this past midwicket
follows it up with a rock-solid forward-defensive
presses right forward to push this down to long-off
jumps out of the crease, only to find he is nowhere close to the pitch of the ball, and defends
quicker, straighter, fuller, gets the inside half of the bat, but it goes along the ground
moves forward and across, gets to the pitch of this, but can't beat mid-off
opens the face on this push-drive, beating cover fielder
seems to be shaving up for a heave, sees the slower delivery, and dabs it towards point
again the front foot clears, the back lift goes high, but again he finds out this is not the ball to hit. Defends it back to Sammy

Shehzad's misery ends! Sammy bowls a bouncer after calling the keeper up! Shehzad looks for the pull, goes hard at it, manages a massive bottom edge onto the stumps. Captain's first wicket of the series
back of a length, into the hips, played to square leg
full and and flat, watchfully defended by Hafeez
into the pads, Hafeez tries the paddle, can't get it past short fine
Hafeez getting impatient, looking for the big sweep, but swinging down the wrong line. Seemed premeditated. Just missed off
cuts from in front of stumps, straight to cover
Bravo misfields at mid-on to try and prevent the easy single, but the misfield doesn't cost them any extra run as Salahuddin has run way past the stumps at the striker's end
stays low, turned away past midwicket without much discomfort
too short for that pace, Hafeez pulls it wide of deep backward square
slower ball, opens the face, but Bravo makes a diving save at point
fuller now, driven straight to cover
nice late-cut, but the third man is fine
slower ball, just back of a length, just outside off, pushed to cover
fuller, inducing the drive, and the edge, but it goes along the ground, past the keeper
short, on the pads, worked away for two
full, on the pads, can't beat midwicket
full and straight again, played back to Bishoo
gives this one a bit of air, pulling him forward, but Usman defends solidly
stays back to push this flatter delivery back to Bishoo
shortish legbreak again, defended again
no point bowling short to Hafeez, not at Sammy's pace at any rate. He rocks back to pull this wide of midwicket, all along the ground
fuller, and still not driveable, that's the length to bowl. Hafeez defends it back
slower ball outside off, stays back and runs this down to third man
another slower ball, pushed to cover
stays low from just back of a length, keeps it out
fuller, outside off, leans into the drive, finds short extra
full, flat, outside off, driven to sweeper-cover
nice legbreak, tossed up, around leg, turning towards off, defended off the front foot
flighted again, this time pushed down to long-off for one
turn and bounce again, nicely flighted around leg, beats Hafeez's attempt at a sweep
goes back to bowling flat, just outside off, opens the face, can't beat point
full, straight, fast, blocks it
length ball, around off, finds the cover fielder
drives with an open face this time to miss the cover fielder, succeeds, and gets a single
another late-cut for another single
extra bounce there, this is similar back of a length, but it kicks up to chest high. Usman does well to keep it down
gives him room here, punched away to sweeper-cover
rolls his fingers over this, the ball grips the surface and gets extra bounce, beating his attempt at another late-cut

Bishoo strikes in front of his home crowd! Well done solja! Usman doesn't seem too thrilled with the decision. And he has reason to feel disappointed. This is an ordinary ordinary decision. Pitched outside leg! Usman misses the sweep, is hit in front. It's common sense: if a big legbreak is hitting the stumps, it can't have pitched in line. Doesn't apply to Asoka, though
middle and leg, pushed back to the bowler
quicker delivery, defended from the crease
worked away off the pads
plays this with the turn, guiding it past cover
quick legbreak outside off, Misbah looks to cut, gets a bottom edge into the ground
back of a length, pushed to straightish midwicket
pulled away nicely towards deep midwicket, where Simmons fumbles, allowing them a second
Hafeez's golden run continues, another fifty for him. This he gets pushing a length ball to long-on. Fifty out of a team total of 72

Sammy strikes! Misbah had no clue about this slower offcutter, and Misbah is caught deep in the crease. The inward movement beat the bat, and hit him on the back pad, above the knee roll. The only question here is the height. On replay I notice the knee was bent significantly, creating an impression that he might have been hit high. Dead plumb
pushes forward to defend a shortish delivery
dabbed away past cover to get off the mark
quick, skiddy legbreak, stays a touch low too, Akmal defends off the back foot. Semi-squatting
gives him the charge, gets too close to the pitch of this, drives it to mid-off
tossed up, defended off the front foot
Taking the legspinner on. This time he is a touch short of the pitch of the ball and can swing the arms freely, clears the front leg, and lofts this straight over the bowler's head
short as expected, and cut away past extra cover. The game is coming alive
opens the face, runs this past point for one
gets his front pad a touch too far across, but plays around it, pushing this to midwicket
angling into the pads, Hafeez is slightly late into this attempted flick
extra bounce, Sammy is managing this every now and then, this time beating Hafeez's attempt at the cut
back of a length, no room, pushed back to Sammy

nearly played on, this one cramps him up, takes the bottom edge, bounces into the ground, Hafeez kicks it away from the stumps. Puts his hand up in "no" to Akmal. Did he actually want a single off that kick? I hope not
well bowled, no room again, pushed back to Sammy. Maiden over
on target, shaping in towards off, pushed back to the bowler
short and wide, but stays low as Akmal looks to cut, bottom-edges into the ground
short, not too wide, punched away for a single

fuller, close to off, pushed to straight midwicket, from where Sammy fires in a wild, unnecessary throw. Baugh has to dive full length. Sammy apologises. Dujon drones: "This is the kind of stuff wicketkeepers have to go through."
slower one, played with an open face, straight to point
into the pads, helped away for an easy single
short ball, pulled away along the ground
back of a length, stump to stump, defended
premeditates a scoop, is down on a knee before Sammy is in his delivery stride, bowls wide of off, Hafeez gets an edge onto the pad
fuller, straighter, pushed to long-on
slower ball outside off, pushed to sweeper-cover
opens the face on this, can't beat point
into the pads, hit straight to Sammy at straight midwicket
cut away behind square for a single
misses out, this was a length ball angling down the pads, hits the pad as he is a touch late into the shot
slightly slower, into the pads, this time he gets it past a scrambling and diving Sammy at straight midwicket
back of a length, same middle and leg line, pushed to straight midwicket
short and wide, cut away to deep point for one
tucked away off the hips, gets a single to fine leg
Bowled'im! Typical dismissal for a track keeping low. Short, not too wide, Hafeez looks for the cut, the ball stays low, takes the bottom edge, and Sammy has three now
high back lift first ball, but the bottom hand comes off as he goes hard at this, driving it to mid-off
Afridi is not going to fool around. Does he ever? Sees a length ball, knows the mid-on is up, and goes over his head. Very little risk involved in this
shorter delivery, outside off, opens the face and gets a single
slower ball, defended to cover
angling down the leg side, flicked away to fine leg
full ball, driven to long-on for one
again extra bounce, kicking into his chest from just back of a length. Keeps it down, though
slower one, too full, driven to long-on
slower offcutter again, and Sammy is alert at straight midwicket again
played on the up for a single down to long-on
not a great start, bowls short and wide, and is cut away, and takes a diving save from Bishoo, running from third man to point region
slightly fuller, closer to off, defended
short and wide again, Akmal gets on top of this, cutting just wide of Bravo at point. Looked like a chance at first go, but it was hit into the ground, so it was dying at Bravo all the time
slower one, and slightly fuller too, defended off the front foot
full, just outside off, straight to straight extra cover

If slow be the pace, if low be the bounce, play on. Third played-on dismissal! Akmal is looking for that dab towards third man, but this is slightly fuller than the ideal length, and takes the toe of the bat and onto the stumps
Bravo stays on target, Afridi defends back
short and wide, gets a single to sweeper-cover
back of a length, around off, watchfully played

Lovely keeping whatever the result be! This is dug in back of a length, there is extra bounce, down the leg side, Baugh makes a collection, sees Salman overbalance, and flicks the bails off. However, Salman gets the back leg in in time
angling into the pads, misses out on an easy single. Late into the shot. Gets the leg-bye, however
big wide down the leg side, another good take by Baugh
slower ball, and Afridi swings wildly. He is looking to go over mid-off, gets a single to square leg
back of a length, middle and leg, pushed to midwicket

What a brute! And they know this is the big one, one who could take this game away. This delivery, though, would have taken the best of them out. Kicks off just back of a length, bounces chest high, and takes the glove as Afridi looks to run it down to third man
oh close, moves across to face a length ball, but gets the bat down in time
slower ball, although it is short and wide, and beats Wahab's attempt at the cut
Rampaul is on fire, length ball, outside off, Riaz pokes at it away from the body, and edges it straight to slip. Well done to the captain and the bowler for having a slip there
and gets a bouncer first up, ducking under it not quite convincingly
double-wicket maiden as Ajmal defends this length ball with an open face
gets an edge right away, turning sharply away, but the edge goes wide of slip, and along the ground too
and he bowls outside leg after getting the extra slip in, paddled away fine
quicker one, Ajmal comes forward and plays around his front leg, gets a single to midwicket
tentative poke outside poke, keeps it down, though
nicely flighted around off, pushed to long-off for one
very slow through the air, the ball turns away, gets the edge, but straight into the ground on its way to second slip
and he guides this teasingly past the second slip
jags back in from back of a length, gets the inside edge, but then it dies after hitting the pad
fuller, swinging in, pushed to mid-off
shout for a catch but not given as this jags back, misses the bat, hits the pad and goes straight to slip. It could have been a leg-before shout too, but it was too high
stretches forward, gets the inside half of the bat onto this, takes a single to square leg
comes forward to defend, takes the single off the inside edge
full, outside leg, paddles it fine for one
nicely driven down to long-off for one
comes right forward to defend it right under his eyes
tossed up outside off, left alone
another forward defensive, covering the turn well
paddled away from the leg line, but straight to short fine
pulled away limply, manages to get is just wide of midwicket
tucked away off the hips, gets a single
Whoa! Another lifter from back of a length, Ajmal does well to avoid it, staying non-committal
Big big shout for LBW, moved in late off the seam, hit Ajmal right in front, but seemed to be going down. Replays show it would have flicked the outside half of the leg stump
pushed to midwicket this time
another inducker, around off, does well to get his bat to it because this wouldn't have gone down the leg side
and starts on target right away, just short of a length, around off, flat, not much turn, defended
this is into the pads, pushed to midwicket
right forward in this defensive shot
another forward defensive
in the zone again, and defended again. Nice batting practice being had
another immaculate forward defensive
bowls short down the leg side, Ajmal pulls, gets a soft edge, but just about eludes Baugh who runs back
full, on the pads, flicked away to long leg
nice short delivery, around off, sways out of the way, drops his wrists
Slight seam movement, good enough to beat the tailender, and he is caught dead in front. He planted the front foot across, and looked to play around it, but the slight movement was enough to beat him
goes for the yorker, misses the line by a long way, conceding a leg-side wide
left alone outside off
goes for the yorker again, dishes up a leg-side half-volley, clipped away for one. Salman doesn't push for the second despite a misfield at the boundary. No desperation to dominate strike here
jumps out of the crease and defends
another forward-defensive
and another defensive shot
pushed wide of mid-off for one
quicker slider, nudged past forward short leg
looks to flick this, hits the forward short leg in the shin
short ball first up, going down the leg side, Salman gets a glove on it, just wide of the keeper
short into the pads again, goes off the thigh, and Baugh does well to dive to his left and saves three runs
nearly an edge, as Junaid hangs his bat outside off
fuller, close to off, edged away wide of slip, along the ground
Shot! Where has this come from? They need a few more of these. Full ball, outside off, and he has driven this between extra cover and mid-off. All along the ground
And Ravi won't get a five-for, Salman keeps this full delivery out
back of a length, tucks him up

That looked adjacent. Full and straight delivery, and Junaid falls over while playing across the line. Hit in front of leg, clipping leg stump. His movement across the line made it loo worse than it was

inn2.comm: flighted outside off, defended
left alone outside off
flighted delivery outside off, defended again
angling into the pads, at pace, and helped away past short fine
played back to Afridi, so a decent start for WI
full outside off, the batsman tries to guide it to third man but misses
has no business flirting with this wide delivery
angled across him, left alone
just outside off, defended
shoulders arms again, in no hurry at all
defended off the front foot
short, gives him enough width to cut away savagely
fired into the pads, there is a leg gully lurking too
big, big shout, it was the googly, Simmons stretched well forward, was hit in front of stumps, but that stride might have saved him
angling in again, keeps it out
quick, into the pads, clicks the pad on the way, flies between keeper and leg slip
provided width, Edwrads comes forwards and drives through extra cover
angled across him, defended away from the body, towards point
on the pads, gets inside the line, clips this away wide of deep backward square leg
nicely punched away wide of mid-off for one
short, angled across him, pulled away wide of midwicket
angled into the pads, pushed away to midwicket
wide down the leg side, and the keeper can't get across in time, this is getting over fast
flat, on the pads, blocked
dropped, it was very difficult. Short legbreak, Edwards goes for a punch, gets a thick inside edge, there is a big deviation, which beats Salman
much slower through the air, Edwards way early into an ugly sweep, misses
quick and full, middle and leg, kept out
looks to punch this square, but is hurried into the stroke
quick, into the pads, pushed to midwicket
digs this in short, gets good lift, tucking him outside off
and from a similar area, this one keeps low, Simmons has to act fast to get the bat down
gets inside the line of this short one and pulls, and just directs it wide of the keeper, using the pace of Riaz
more sloppy work from Pakistan, this one was left enough, and Salman didn't collect it clean. It was low, but wasn't dying. Bye conceded
risky shot, across the line, the bat coming down at the last moment, gets a single to square leg
flicked away from outside off, they take a single to square leg, and Misbah concedes an overthrow too
sharp offbreak, wide down the leg side
appeal for lbw, offbreak, pitches outside off, hits him in front, but there is an inside edge
flighted outside off, pushed back
another big offbreak, another bat-pad, would he better served with leg slip moving to forward short leg?
played around the front pad, to square leg
stretches forward to defend this towards cover
big wide down the leg side
full and flat, pushed back to Ajmal
angled across him, driven to extra cover
clipped off the pads, past midwicket, easy three runs
left alone outside off
defended towards extra cover
length delivery, around off, driven down to mid-off
odd shot, looking to pull it from well wide of off, gets the toe end, but goes through with the shot, and it flies past mid-off - yes mid-off! - for four
worked away off the pads
doosra, well outside off, Edwards is drawn into swiping, is beaten by the away movement
another doosra, this time closer to off, defended back
offbreak, he comes forward and blocks it
doosra again, stays back and defends it, was a bit too short to bother it
stretches well forward and defends
angled across him, punched towards cover
wide outside off, left alone
tucks him up with the angle, pushed to leg
looks to drive, away from the body, gets a thick edge past point
half-volley, in his swinging zone, Edwards stands tall, and muscles it between the bowler and mid-off
short of a length, around off, played back to Riaz
comes well forward to block this
sharp offbreak, going down the leg side, beating him, hitting him high on the pad
doosra, but too short, and Simmons rocks back and adjusts well for the away turn, and cuts this in front of square
pushes forward with bat and pad close together, gets an inside edge onto the pad, but it dies into the pitch
backs away, then cuts it from in front of off, but can't beat point
very well bowled, doosra it is, this time pitches on the in-between spot. Simmons is neither forward nor back, the outside edge is duly taken, but it goes between the keeper and slip
tossed up wide, pushed to cover
blocked back to the bowler, looked like he wanted to slog this, but changed his mind
punched wide of mid-off
full ball outside off, dead-batted
pitched up outside off, placed wide of cover
comes down the track and chips this to wide long-on
flighted outside off, pushed square on the off side
wide down the leg side

dropped by Hafeez at slip, it was a tough tough chance, might you. This was a flat offbreak, Simmons went for a full-blooded cut, got a thick edge, and it flew just to the right of Hafeez, at a catchable height
lovely shot, Simmons looks good when he lofts down the ground, which is what he did this time. Inside-out, over mid-off
and suddenly, he looks for a flashy shot across the line, is hit on the pad, but the ball is headed down the leg side
pushed wide of extra cover for one
doosra, Edwards goes back and defends
flighted outside off, defended to cover
Simmons is a man in a hurry. He gives Hafeez the charge early, and is beaten in the flight, but recovers very well, making room, and then lofting this over square leg. Top shot
similar attempt, but this time the ball is faster, and he pushes it to leg
driven down to long-on for one
turning into the pads, turned to square leg
shorter, pushed to square leg again
toppie, gets a leading edge as he looks to turn this to leg. Safe
they steal the single after hitting straight to Riaz at mid-on
driven to the right of mid-off for one
defended back to Ajmal
looks to work this square, finds square leg
hit straight to mid-off
turning into the pads, helped away for one
opens the face on the quick legbreak, gets a single
full and wide down the leg side
short, pushed down to long-off for one
another fifty for Simmons, pushes a short delivery down to long-on, coolly acknowledges the applause
fuller now, going straight, cramping him up as he looks to force this to leg
comes right forward to defend this
defends in front of his front pad
goes deep into the crease to work this wide of square leg
clipped off the pads for one
angled across him, more of a toppie, defended
appeal for lbw as he stretches forward to defend this, is beaten by the offbreak, and not sure if it straightened enough
quick offbreak, turned away to short fine

Drama. Edwards pushed to cover and ran. Sent back. Dived back in as the throw came in. The bat was behind the line, but in air after impact. However, the keeper's attempt at removing the bails missed too. For a second, nobody reacted. Then the keeper realised the bat was still in the same position. Edwards saw him going for it, and tried to press the bat in. It's all tough and go, though, and there is no angle clear enough to conclusively tell either way. Hence not-out
short legbreak, easily pushed down to long-on for one
full delivery, driven down the ground for another single
too full again, again long-on is brought into action
goes inside out, past extra cover for one
cut away in front of square, can't beat cover
resumes with a no-ball, driven wide of mid-off for one
full outside off, makes room, is caught at point, wants one, but is sent back. Would have been run out had Akmal's throw hit
back of a length, around off, pushed back to the bowler
full and wide outside off, too wide
another big wide outside off
this one stays low and bounces awkwardly in front of Salman, who concedes a bye
lovely shot, moving across, getting inside the line of a ball bowled at middle stump, and clips it wide of midwicket
stays low again, bouncing well in front of Salman, but he does well this time
clipped off the pads - a 100-run opening stand
full on the pads, played straight to midwicket
swept away to long leg for one
down the leg side again, goes for the slog sweep, but misses
cut away to sweeper-cover
angling into the pads, turned around the corner
Simmons wants to go limin in Guyana as soon as possible! This time he plays the semi-slog successfully, depositing Afridi over wide long-on
more sloppiness from Pakistan, this angles in, clips the pad, bounces in front of Salman, who doesn't collect cleanly, but the ball has hardly gone six feet away, and WI steal a leg-bye
moves well across to try and play this fine, but is hit in the exposed area between the pad and thigh pad. How unlucky do you have to be to be hit there?
hit to the right of Afridi at mid-off, who sticks his foot out, and they take the second off the ricochet
driven to sweeper-cover now
gets a bit big around the hip area, but he has overstepped
Shot! Short delivery outside off, rocks back, pulls it, smack off the middle of the bat, over midwicket. Flat six
this is a proper bouncer, getting towards the shoulder, Simmons is forced to fend, but the lob falls in the vacant short third man area
flicked away off the pads, wide of Misbah at midwicket
turned around the corner
not short enough to be cut, but he cuts it nevertheless, gets a single
doosra but wide outside off, and he cuts it in front of square, this is ending fast
forward defensive now
another forward-defensive
resumes with a wide down the leg side
full on the pads, clipped away for a single
half-pull-half-flick over midwicket, gets another couple
full, on off, driven to mid-off
hit straight to midwicket, Misbah hits the stumps direct for no reason, and concedes an overthrow. No one is interested in spending an extra second on the field than absolutely necessary
on the pads, and clipped away for another single
slower ball, you could see him changing the grip, pushed wide of mid-on for one
bowls a short legcutter, concedes the single to long-on
and Shehzad bowls a no-ball! One that turns away beautifully and takes the outside edge, which is taken too
misses out on the free hit, though, getting the bottom edge

it's only fitting that the match finish with a stolen single after a hit straight to point, and then the other run coming through a wild overthrow. Pakistan have fielded and bowled like millionaires when they had in reality a small target to defend
